Key Match Events: Rishab Pant plays his vintage reverse sweep of seamer over the keeper for a six to finish off things for India.
Rohit Sharma has reached his half-century.
Jasprit Bumrah bowls a yorker and picks Little and kills any hope Ireland had of late burst.
Hardik Pandya picks three wickets and led the way as Rohit Sharma’s men bundled out Ireland for 96.
Arshdeep Singh picks up Paul Stirling.
Mohammed Siraj took the new ball from the other end and there was a steep bounce of the length.
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma said he tried to convince head coach Rahul Dravid to stay beyond T20 World Cup: ‘It’s been very fruitful’.
Rahul Dravid on Monday confirmed that the ongoing T20 World Cup is his last dance with the national team.
Rahul Dravid on leaving coaching job part 2: ‘It’s no different for me. I love doing the job’.
Paul Stirling at toss: ‘Coming with pretty good prep, we were in Amsterdam recently. We've got plenty of matchwinners in our side, want them to show up on the day’.
Rohit Sharma at toss: ‘We're going to bowl. Preparations have been alright. Have been managing ourselves in these new conditions’.
Post-Match Reflections: Jasprit Bumrah Player Of The Match: ‘Coming from India, with the ball seaming around, I wouldn't complain when there's help for bowlers’.
Rohit Sharma: ‘Yeah, just a little sore (the arm). I said it at the toss as well. Quite unsure of what to expect from the pitch’.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch at the venue has been under scrutiny for its sluggish nature.
Another challenge for batters at the ground is the slow outfield.
India vs Ireland T20 World Cup match will be streamed on the Hotstar App and telecast on the Star Sports Network on June 5, Wednesday from 8 PM IST.
According to weather.com, the morning weather at Nassau County Stadium is expected to be bright and clear with temperatures around 30°C.
